<p>His name is synonymous with football.</p>
<p>Edson Arantes do Nascimento, famously known as Pele, is widely regarded as one of the greatest players of all time.</p>
<p>The Brazilian-born star is a veteran of four World Cups with a strike rate of one goal in every international game that he played.</p>
<p>In all, Pele put more than 1200 balls into the back of the net during a career that spanned two decades and ended with American club New York Cosmos in 1977.</p>
<p>The retirement of Pele and other great players of the era saw the game&#039;s popularity gradually wane in the United States to the point that Cosmos, the most glamorous club in the U.S., folded in 1984.</p>
<p>Twenty-five years on, Pele is back serving as the club&#039;s honorary President, spearheading its revival.</p>
<p>Becky Anderson will be talking to this giant of the sport on Monday about New York Cosmos&#039;s first game in a quarter of a century against Britain&#039;s Manchester United.</p>
<p>If there is something you would like to ask the great Pele, leave your questions here.</p>
